title: U.S. wins bronze, Shiffrin-Breezy 4th in team run
content: Although Mikaela Shiffrin finished fourth after Breezy Johnson gave her a first-run lead, the U.S. still won bronze in the team combined event Tuesday, as Austria won gold.

content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

content: He alleges that across the State, people from all sections are extremely angry with the DMK government

content: He points out that the State‚Äôs share in India‚Äôs total electronics exports during FY2025 was around 41% at $15 billion, and this is likely to have increased to 45% in FY2026. He also expresses concern that the Centre has not yet released State-wise data on electronics exports for the current financial year

title: Devadasi survey: 6,222 fresh applications still pending before taluk/district panels in Karnataka
content: Amid questions over the nearly 50% decline in the number of former Devadasis across 15 districts in Karnataka in the latest survey report, 6,222 fresh applications to be included in the list of former devadasis are pending before taluk/district-level committees

content: Chairman Madhu Murthy says over 1,000 faculty members and 1,00,000 students were trained, with ‚Çπ8 lakh awarded to students during AQVH 2025

content: Vikram Misri assured the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs that farmers‚Äô interests would be protected and would not be compromised under the deal

title: Amit Shah calls for urgent action to stem the rot of cyber fraud
content: Cybersecurity is no longer limited to economic security, but is now an integral part of national security, said Mr. Shah

title: Chikkamagaluru farmer cuts sandalwood branches near Vidhana Soudha to protest NHAI action on his farm
content: NHAI has taken over four acres of land at Haliyur for the NH-206 work. Vishu Kumar, a sandalwood grower, alleged that he has been denied a fair compensation

title: Family forced to carry body of relative home on two-wheeler in Andhra Pradesh as government hospital has no ambulance
content: When the impoverished family approached private auto drivers, they demanded up to ‚Çπ2,000 to transport the body. Collector says Bapatla Area Hospital did not have a hearse van as it did not qualify to have one based on mortality figures.

title: Supreme Court asks Election Commission to consider writ petitioner‚Äôs suggestions against excessive poll expenditure
content: Citing a report on poll spending, the petitioner asks for rethink on expenses cap, plan of action against erring candidates; ECI defends its oversight mechanism, questions the report‚Äôs authenticity

title: Stale food seized during raids in Guntur
content: Food Safety and Legal Metrology officials inspect 16 food units across the city, seize cooked food and sweets, and issue notices for hygiene lapses and licence violations

title: VMC council approves revised expenditure budget of ‚Çπ1.64 lakh crore for 2026-27
content: Budget estimates, both capital income and expenditure, revised after YSRCP corporators¬†raise objections to allocation of ‚Çπ450 crore for stormwater drain project

title: Mohammed Deepak gets wave of support across India after news of his gym membership decline goes viral
content: Mr. Deepak came into the national spotlight after he confronted a mob of right-wing members accused of harassing a 71-year-old Muslim garment seller and pressuring him to change the name of his shop

title: We suspect that Ajit Pawar‚Äôs death was sabotage, not an accident, says family
content: During his one-and-a-half hour press conference, Mr. Rohit Pawar claimed that there were contradictions about the timing of the crash in the ATC transcript and in the report given by the Union Aviation Ministry

title: Congress likely to focus on trade deal as Budget discussion gets underway in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi to speak in the House; Opposition agrees to allow normal functioning to raise crucial issues, including the trade deal, during the Budget discussion

title: Retired IB officer to lead peace talks with Naga, Kuki-Zo groups as MHA‚Äôs Northeast Adviser
content: Ajit Lal is a retired IPS officer, former JIC chief, and former IB special director; though the newly-elected BJP recommended him as interlocutor for the Naga peace talks in 2014, he was passed over for R.N. Ravi, now T.N. Governor

title: ECI extends deadline for Bengal SIR hearings to Feb. 14; final rolls to be published on Feb. 28
content: Extension follows a Supreme Court order and a request from the Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal which cited pending hearings, scrutiny, and¬†digitisation¬†work

title: Career progression of Agniveers: Home Ministry sidesteps Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs query
content: Home Ministry cites Allocation of Business rules to justify coordinating¬†post-service transition of ex-Agniveers, without addressing¬†concerns¬†over¬†overlap with¬†Defence¬†Ministry.

title: Former Army General Naravane confirms Penguin‚Äôs claim that memoir is as yet unpublished as Delhi Police file FIR
content: ‚ÄúNo copies of the book, either in print or digital form, have been published, distributed, sold, or otherwise made available to the public by Penguin Random House India,‚Äù the publishing house said; Gen. Naravane‚Äôs clarification follows remarks by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who cited a December 2023 social media post by Gen Naravane to counter the publisher‚Äôs claim

title: Watch: Rohit Pawar questions Ajit Pawar aircraft crash, seeks international probe
content: NCP (SP) leader Rohit Pawar has raised serious questions over whether the aircraft crash involving Ajit Pawar was an accident or a planned conspiracy. He flagged missing technical data, alleged safety lapses and last-minute crew changes, while demanding clarity on fuel practices and flight decisions. Pawar has now called for an independent international investigation alongside the government probe.

title: Why can‚Äôt Human Rights Commission become ‚Äòad hoc‚Äô Information Commission in States with few RTI appeals, asks Supreme Court
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, heading a three-judge Bench, says the ‚Äòad-hoc mechanism‚Äô could continue till the number of RTI appeals increases in ‚Äòdue course of time‚Äô and ‚Äòjustifies the creation of an independent Information Commission‚Äô

title: Opposition questions Centre on price rise, growing inequality in Rajya Sabha
content: Pointing at various reports on widening inequality in the country, Trinamool Congress MP Sukhendu Sekhar Roy warns of social upheaval if the government does not address it

title: ED steps into Tirumala laddu ghee adulteration case
content: Agency registers case and initiates probe amid indications of hawala transactions linked to ghee procurement approvals

title: VACB opens preliminary inquiry into installation of new flag mast at the Sabarimala Ayyappa temple in 2017
content: The UDF-appointed TDB had ordered the installation under the questionable premise that termites had infested the concrete pillar, which was covered with gold-plated copper cladding, rendering it unstable.¬†Former TDB member and Congress leader Ajay Tharayil denies any wrongdoing and says the decision had the sanction of the High Court-appointed Amicus Curiae

title: Key chord line to ease Secunderabad congestion nears completion
content: Signalling interlocking works are currently underway, after which the section will be opened for traffic; officials estimate that the new route will save up to 30 minutes of travel time, as trains will no longer need to take a 15‚Äëkm detour via Malkajgiri and Lallaguda Gate stations

title: ‚ÄòOne-sided‚Äô deal will flood Indian markets with U.S. products, say MPs
content: It will adversely affect farmers as well as industry, and dent the Make-in-India initiative, says Opposition in Lok Sabha

title: Bharatiya Kisan Union opposes deal with U.S., to burn effigies of Modi, Trump
content: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait says Centre had lost the trust of farmers and the trade agreements with U.S. and European Union will have far-reaching adverse impacts on farmers

title: Watch: Congress-led Opposition moves no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker
content: Opposition parties led by the Congress on February 10 moved a no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, accusing him of partisan conduct amid repeated disruptions in the House.

title: BRS accuses State government of allowing A.P. draw excess Krishna water
content: BRS leader and former minister Harish Rao says A.P. has availed 80% water already against its ad hoc entitlement of 66%

title: Speaker to stay away from Lok Sabha proceedings till Opposition‚Äôs petition against him is disposed of
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju posts February 4 Lok Sabha footage, showing women Congress MPs near PM‚Äôs seat; says ‚Äúvery ugly scenes‚Äù were prevented by restraining BJP members

title: Students from Karnataka can practice as nurses in Kerala, says HC
content: Several BSc Nursing students from nursing colleges in Karnataka were being denied registration in Kerala

title: Soldier due for disability pension, if chronic disability was due to military service: Kerala HC
content: Court directs payment of disability pension arrears to B. Manikuttan, a native of Mavelikara who served as a Havildar in the Army

title: Naidu presses Centre for statutory backing to Amaravati, financial support
content: Chief Minister discusses Amaravati capital Bill, State finances and key issues with Union Home and Finance Ministers in New Delhi

title: Watch: India‚ÄìU.S. trade deal a surrender of reciprocity, says Tharoor
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor criticised the India‚ÄìU.S. interim trade agreement during the Lok Sabha Budget debate, calling it a pre-committed purchase pact rather than a fair trade deal.

title: Scientists showcase advances in health care, genetics and knowledge systems at research conference
content: A major highlight of the day at the National Research Conference being held in Thiruvananthapuram was a breakthrough in Alzheimer‚Äôs research that could transform early diagnosis for Kerala‚Äôs ageing population

title: T.N. officials prepare for upcoming Census 2027 activities
content: During the session, the critical nature of the exercise was emphasised upon and a roadmap of the essential action points to be prioritized by was provided

title: Adult male tiger set for reintroduction into wild
content: The expert committee says that the tiger was ‚Äòinnocent‚Äô as it did not attack any human being during its 53-day¬†sojourn in the four States; the historic operation, in which the tiger was tranquilised in the human settlement without causing any harm to it, is coined ‚ÄòStripes‚Äô

title: Pallikaranai Ramsar site land dispute: Madras High Court dismisses two PILs
content: The dismissal of the PIL petitions clears the legal hurdle in construction of high rise residential towers by Brigade Enterprises Limited

title: Handle Deeksha devotees with dignity at Srisailam, CM cautions officials
content: Chandrababu Naidu directs zero tolerance for lapses, orders daily planning and tighter crowd management as pilgrim rush is set to peak ahead of Mahasivaratri at the Srisailam temple

title: Devotees throng Gunadala Mary Matha Shrine to offer prayers
content: Devotees from Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and places across Andhra Pradesh attend the 102nd Utsavams

title:
IOCL biogas plant in Tirumala will be 
operational by May, says TTD Chairman
content: With a proposed capacity of 40 tonnes of biogas per day, the plant is projected to help TTD save around ‚Çπ1.52 crore annually, says B.R. Naidu

title: Embrace the spirit of people-friendly policing, SPC tells new SI recruits
content: Ravada A. Chandrasekhar urges officers to adapt to evolving crime patterns at Kerala Police Academy passing-out parade

title: Private hospitals express apprehensions about KCE Act
content: As registration begins, many smaller hospitals fear they may struggle to meet the new requirements under the Kerala Clinical Establishments Act. Kerala Private Hospitals‚Äô Association moves the SC against the High Court ruling, which  fully endorsed the Act.

title: Political parties slam government over lathi charge on Siva devotees at Srisailam
content: Opposition and BJP leaders allege administrative failure, insensitivity towards pilgrims and breakdown of temple management, seek action against officials and political accountability

title: Crops damaged after irrigation canal breach in Vijayapura district
content: BJP leaders have demanded that the State government release compensation to farmers who suffered crop loss

title: Gujarat Couple Kidnapped In Azerbaijan, Rescued With Foreign Ministry's Help
content: A couple from Gujarat's Anand district on their way to the US was kidnapped and held hostage in Azerbaijan with abductors demanding ransom for their release, but the pair was rescued with help from the Indian foreign ministry.

title: Telangana Civic Body Polls To Be Held Today, Counting On Friday
content: Over 52 lakh voters will decide the fate of about 13,000 candidates in elections to 116 municipalities and seven municipal corporations in Telangana on Wednesday, seen as a test of popularity for the ruling Congress, as well as opposition BJP and BRS

title: Family Of Delhi Man Killed In 2016 Road Accident Gets Rs 83-Lakh Compensation
content: A motor accident claims tribunal here has awarded a compensation of Rs 82.86 lakh to the family of a 34-year-old Delhi Fire Services (DFS) staff who died in a road accident in 2016.

title: US Lawmaker Introduces Bill To End H-1B Visa Program
content: A US lawmaker has introduced a bill to end the H-1B visa program, saying corporations have repeatedly abused this system and imported cheaper foreign labour into America.

title: Canadian Woman Alleges Inappropriate Touch At Bengaluru Hotel Spa
content: A case has been registered on the complaint of a woman from Canada after she alleged that a male therapist at the spa of a luxury hotel here misbehaved with her, police said on Tuesday.

title: 9 Countries, 5 Decades: How A USB Drive Unmasked French Paedophile
content: A French prosecutor has made public the identity of a 79-year-old former educator accused of raping and sexually assaulting 89 minors over more than five decades.

title: AAP MP Raghav Chadha Urges Centre To Legalise Virtual Digital Assets
content: MP Raghav Chadha today said India taxes Virtual Digital Assets - which include cryptocurrencies, stablecoins, and tokenised assets - like they are legal but regulates them like they are illegal, urging the government to bring in rules to protect them

title: Florida To Carry Out Its First Execution Of 2026 Today
content: A 64-year-old man convicted of murdering a travelling salesman is to be put to death by lethal injection on Tuesday in Florida, the US state that carried out more executions last year than any other.

title: CBI Handling NEET Aspirant Death Case, But SIT Served DNA Test Notice: Family
content: Family members of a NEET aspirant in Bihar alleged on Tuesday that the SIT of the police, which had been probing into the case, has served them with a notice for a DNA test, though the matter has been "handed over" to the CBI.

title: This January Was Earth's Fifth-Hottest On Record: EU Report
content: The planet experienced its fifth-hottest January on record despite a cold snap that swept across the United States and Europe, the EU's climate monitor said Tuesday.

title: 3-Year Heatwave Bleached Over Half Of Earth's Coral Reefs: Study
content: A study published on Tuesday showed that more than half of the world's coral reefs were bleached between 2014-2017 -- a record-setting episode now being eclipsed by another series of devastating heatwaves.

title: UP Woman Missing, Family Finds 5-Foot 'Snake Skin' On Bed
content: In a quiet village in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district, the disappearance of a young woman has sparked a wave of superstition, mystery, and a frantic police search.

title: Will Continue To Buy Cheap, Best Quality Oil: Centre To Parliamentary Panel
content: The government on informed a parliamentary panel that India will continue to import crude oil from the countries where it is cheap and of the best quality, and the Indian oil companies will purchase oil, considering the geopolitical situation.

title: UP Man, 19, Gets Life Sentence For Killing Minor, Parading Her Corpse
content: A court here on Tuesday sentenced a 19-year-old man to life imprisonment for brutally murdering a 15-year-old schoolgirl and carrying her body on his shoulder through the village.

title: IndiGo Says It Has 'Optimum' Pilot Pool As Flight Duty Norm Relaxations End
content: IndiGo, which faced massive flight disruptions in early December, on Tuesday said it has an optimum pool of staff to ensure stable operations as regulator DGCA's temporary pilot duty norm relaxations for the country's largest airline come to an end.

title: Mumbai Court Cuts Rape Convict's Life Term, Cites Essay On Mahatma Gandhi
content: The Bombay High Court has reduced the life sentence of a man, convicted for raping a minor girl, to 12 years, taking note of his young age, long incarceration and reformative efforts in prison.

title: Congress Versus Ally National Conference Over Rs 3,000-Crore Loan To J&K
content: An interest-free Central Government funding has sparked major controversy in Jammu and Kashmir after the Congress joined issue with the Opposition PDP and blamed the Omar Abdullah government.

title: Himachal Judge Duped Of Rs 6 Lakh In 'Money Doubling' Scam
content: Police on Tuesday registered a case of cheating against unknown persons after a judge here was allegedly duped of Rs 6 lakh under the ruse of doubling the amount, an official said.

title: Omar Abdullah's "Shoe-Beating" Remark Infuriates BJP Lawmakers
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Tuesday expressed concern in the state Assembly over the Indo-US trade deal, which has reduced duty on US agricultural products to zero, stating it hasn't benefited the Union Territory.

title: Trump‚Äôs zero-tariff clause for B'desh: Will India‚Äôs textile exports lose edge?
content: The India-US trade framework was being seen as an important breakthrough that could improve access to America‚Äôs $118 billion textile and apparel import market. The US is already India‚Äôs largest destination for textile exports.

title: 'From 150 members to 12': Uttarakhand gym owner counts cost of becoming 'Mohammad Deepak'
content: A gym owner in Kotdwara, Uttarakhand, has seen his business plummet from over 150 members to just a dozen after confronting Bajrang Dal activists. The dispute began when activists protested a shop's name, leading to clashes involving the gym owner, who identified himself as 'Mohammad Deepak'. Security has been increased amid threats of further action.

title: No-confidence motion: Speaker Om Birla not to preside till decision on oppn's notice
content: The Congress on Tuesday moved a no-confidence notice against Birla, accusing him of repeated partisan conduct during the ongoing Budget session. The party alleged that he denied leader of the opposition Rahul Gandhi the opportunity to speak and ordered the suspension of opposition MPs. Sources told news agency ANI that opposition MPs alleged "blatantly partisan" conduct and that leaders of Opposition parties were not allowed to speak.

title: 'This is the status of the book': Ex-army chief MM Naravane reacts to row over memoir
content: Former Army chief Manoj Mukund Naravane has backed his publisher, Penguin, regarding his unpublished memoir, "Four Stars of Destiny." The book's circulation has sparked a political storm, leading to an FIR and Lok Sabha disruptions after an excerpt was attempted to be quoted by Rahul Gandhi. Penguin stated that any circulating copies are unauthorized and infringe copyright.

title: Sam Altman's advice to employees and investors: Here's what he said
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman reports renewed momentum, with ChatGPT exceeding 10% monthly growth and over 800 million weekly users. The company is also launching an updated chat model and sees "insane" 50% weekly growth in its Codex coding product.

title: Sahibzada Farhan's fifty and spin attack power Pakistan past USA by 32 runs
content: Pakistan defeated the United States by 32 runs in a T20 World Cup match. Sahibzada Farhan starred with a rapid 73, setting a strong total. Pakistan's spinners then restricted the USA. Shubham Ranjane and Shayan Jahangir showed fight for the USA. The win places Pakistan at the top of Group A.

title: Plane with 55 on board crashes after takeoff in Somalia; all survive ‚Äî watch
content: A Fokker 50 aircraft carrying 55 people experienced a technical fault shortly after takeoff from Mogadishu, forcing an emergency landing. The plane overshot the runway and came to rest in shallow water. All passengers and crew were safely evacuated, with the pilot commended for his swift actions.

title: 'Not going to be easy': Sourav Ganguly warns Pakistan in high-stakes World Cup showdown
content: Former captain Sourav Ganguly expressed his enthusiasm for India's upcoming T20 World Cup encounter against Pakistan on February 15. He believes India, a strong team, will pose a significant challenge. Ganguly also highlighted his admiration for Abhishek Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, Suryakumar Yadav, and Ishan Kishan within the current squad, noting the tournament's exciting start.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: Over Rs 72,000 crore in unclaimed bank deposits transferred to RBI fund: Government
content: Over Rs 72,000 crore in unclaimed bank deposits, untouched for a decade, have been transferred to the RBI's Depositor Education and Awareness Fund. Public sector banks hold the largest portion. The government has launched UDGAM to help people trace their money and introduced measures to prevent further accumulation, aiming to boost financial literacy.

title: India to keep buying cheapest, best-quality crude, govt tells parliamentary panel
content: India will prioritize competitive pricing and suitable quality for crude oil imports, while carefully navigating geopolitical landscapes and avoiding sanctioned sources. Discussions also centered on the India-US interim trade agreement and the proposed India-EU Free Trade Agreement, with officials highlighting progress and upcoming developments.

title: T20 WC: Key all-rounders sidelined as Sri Lanka and New Zealand face injury blow
content: Sri Lanka and New Zealand face significant blows as key all-rounders Wanindu Hasaranga and Michael Bracewell are out of the T20 World Cup due to injuries. Hasaranga's hamstring tear and Bracewell's calf issue have led to replacements Dushan Hemantha and Cole McConchie joining their respective squads. Both teams must now adapt their strategies mid-tournament.

title: SpaceX delays Mars mission, Musk says: ‚ÄòIt is only possible to travel to Mars when ‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: SpaceX is shifting its near-term focus from Mars to establishing a self-sustaining city on the Moon, citing faster timelines and more frequent launch opportunities. Elon Musk stated a Moon city could be achieved in under 10 years, while Mars would take over two decades.

title: Super Bowl night turns serious as Keion White is shot and has surgery
content: San Francisco 49ers defensive end Keion White was shot in the leg early Monday morning at a Mission District nightclub after an argument during a private party. Police say the shooting happened around 4:06 a.m. on Mission Street. White underwent surgery and is recovering. No suspect has been named, and the investigation is ongoing.

title: Sam Darnold paid nearly $250K in California taxes after Super Bowl win
content: Seattle Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold faced a significant financial setback despite winning Super Bowl LX. California's high income tax rate meant Darnold owed an estimated $249,000 in state taxes on his earnings, exceeding his $178,000 Super Bowl bonus.

title: Padraig Harrington and Caroline‚Äôs combined net worth in pro golf
content: Padraig Harrington, a celebrated Irish golfer with over 25 years of elite competition, boasts an estimated net worth of $40 million, largely from his significant career earnings and sponsorship deals. His career highlights include three major championship victories and consistent success on both the PGA Tour and PGA Tour Champions, solidifying his legacy as one of golf's greats.

title: Meet Tiffany Stratton‚Äôs new boyfriend after split with Ludwig Kaiser
content: WWE Superstar Tiffany Stratton has reportedly moved on from her relationship with Ludwig Kaiser and is now dating fellow WWE signee Shady Elnahas. Elnahas solidified their new romance by getting a permanent tattoo of Stratton's eye on his forearm, a bold move that quickly went viral and confirmed the seriousness of their relationship to fans.

title: IND vs PAK: 'Going to Colombo a challenge' - Doeschate on why Pakistan have the edge
content: India say they were always mentally prepared to face Pakistan on February 15, with assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate stressing off-field issues never affected preparations, though Pakistan may have a logistical edge in Colombo. Opener Abhishek Sharma missed training due to illness and could be rested, with Sanju Samson a possible replacement.

title: 'My heart broke': Why a 5-year-old was not allowed to sit on a swing in famous park
content: A five-year-old girl, Inika, was denied a swing at a park due to her perceived disability, causing her distress. Inika, a survivor of severe brain injury, defied doctors' grim prognoses through her parents' unwavering dedication and therapy. Her experience highlights societal inclusivity challenges for children with differences.

title: IndiGo says pilot strength adequate as DGCA‚Äôs temporary duty norm relaxations end
content: IndiGo assures stable operations as DGCA's temporary pilot duty norm relaxations end. Following significant flight disruptions and cancellations in early December, the airline faced regulatory scrutiny. The DGCA had granted exemptions until February 10 to aid stabilization, but pilot bodies emphasize safety over fatigue concerns.

title: Happy Promise Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes for your special someone
content: Promise Day arrives on February 11, encouraging genuine communication and effort in relationships. It offers a pause for honesty and reassurance, emphasizing presence and consistency over grand gestures. This day serves as a simple reminder to nurture connections amidst busy lives. It highlights that small, achievable promises build real trust and strengthen bonds.

title: ECI extends SIR in poll-bound Bengal by 2 weeks; final rolls on Feb 28
content: In a letter to the Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal, the Election Commission said the decision was taken in compliance with the Supreme Court‚Äôs February 9 order. Earlier, the final voters‚Äô list was scheduled to be published on February 14, with elections to follow after completion of the exercise.

title: Goldman Sachs lifts India growth forecast, cuts CAD estimate after India-US trade deal
content: Goldman Sachs has boosted India's economic growth forecast for 2026 to 6.9% and reduced its current account deficit estimate to 0.8% of GDP. This positive revision follows the India-US trade deal, which lowers US tariffs on Indian exports. The brokerage also noted the Indian Rupee's recent strength, though further appreciation is unlikely, and expects interest rates to remain stable.

title: When cosmic relationships turn toxic: How some stars feed on their companions
content: Cosmic relationships in space mirror human connections, with some stars locked in destructive, codependent partnerships. Binary systems featuring white dwarfs often exhibit this imbalance, where one star siphons material from its companion, leading to energetic outbursts like novae. Systems like EX Hydrae and HM Sagittae showcase these extreme interactions, where prolonged feeding can reshape space and prove fatal for one or both stars.

title: Rahul Gandhi didn't speak first on budget debate to avoid ‚Äòengineered disruptions': Report
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will not begin the Union Budget debate today. He cited concerns over potential disruptions from the treasury benches. Gandhi is now expected to speak on Wednesday. The decision follows a notice by opposition parties to remove the Lok Sabha Speaker. Shashi Tharoor initiated the debate. Several opposition members have been suspended this session.

title: Ranveer Singh receives extortion threat after firing outside Rohit Shetty‚Äôs house
content: Ranveer Singh has reportedly received a threat from an unidentified sender, as the underworld appears to be tightening its grip around Mumbai‚Äôs entertainment industry, days after a firing incident outside filmmaker Rohit Shetty‚Äôs residence.

title: No Abhishek in India's first training session in Delhi - here's why
content: India opener Abhishek Sharma missed training in New Delhi due to stomach illness, putting his availability for the Namibia match in doubt. He had a golden duck against the USA and did not field, with Sanju Samson replacing him. Mohammed Siraj said, ‚ÄúAbhishek Sharma has an upset tummy, that's why he didn't field. He will be back fine.‚Äù India may rest him ahead of the Pakistan clash, recalling Samson if needed.

title: Gold, silver rate today: Yellow metal extends rally; silver slips nearly 3%
content: Silver prices plummeted by nearly 3% to Rs 2.64 lakh per kg in Delhi on Tuesday, while gold saw a Rs 2,200 gain per 10 grams, reaching Rs 1.60 lakh. This divergence occurred amidst a firm US dollar and anticipation of key US economic data.  Traders are observing a consolidation phase in precious metals.

title: Travis Kelce reportedly felt awkward with Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds
content: As Taylor Swift deals with probably being called to court after her controversial text exchange with Blake Lively was made public, it seems Travis Kelce was never fond of their company. Just a few hours ago, an insider has claimed that Travis Kelce reportedly felt uncomfortable while hanging out with the Hollywood power couple and is now pretty concerned about Taylor Swift.

title: 120 oppn MPs move no-confidence against Om Birla - what is next
content: The Congress has filed a no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, citing partisan conduct during the Budget session. The opposition alleges denial of speaking time to Rahul Gandhi and suspension of MPs. This extraordinary step, supported by 120 MPs, aims to address perceived undemocratic practices in Parliament.

title: India needs $14.23tn investment in power sector by 2070 to meet net-zero goal: Niti Aayog
content: India needs a massive $14.23 trillion investment in its power sector by 2070 for a net-zero future, with renewables dominating generation.  Electricity's role in consumption will surge, requiring a 14-fold increase in installed capacity.  Decarbonizing transport and securing critical mineral supplies are also vital for achieving climate goals.

title: Still no India No. 1 Erigaisi as Norway Chess reveals new participant
content: Norway Chess has confirmed Alireza Firouzja for its 2026 event in Oslo, while India No. 1 Arjun Erigaisi is still not in the announced lineup. Firouzja, a former prodigy who became a GM at 14 and the youngest to reach 2800 rating, has twice played the Candidates and finished runner-up at Norway Chess before. India will be represented by world champion Gukesh and R Praggnanandhaa, with more names to be revealed.

title: Reducing China dependence: India eyes critical minerals deals with France, Brazil, Canada
content: India is actively pursuing agreements with Brazil, Canada, France, and the Netherlands to jointly explore, extract, and process critical minerals like lithium and rare earth elements. This strategic move aims to secure vital raw materials for the nation's energy transition and reduce dependence on China, which currently dominates global supply chains for these essential resources.

title: Tracy Scroggins‚Äô cause of death revealed as CTE battle highlights football risks
content: Former Detroit Lions defender Tracy Scroggins has died at 56. His family released a statement where they stated that he spent his retirement battling the effects of CTE, a brain disease linked to repeated head trauma, being the cause of his untimely demise.

title: 35% of under-5 kids are stunted in India: Doctor explains what‚Äôs failing
content: A staggering 35% of Indian children under five are stunted, a consequence of chronic undernutrition impacting development and future potential. Experts highlight that while programs exist, implementation gaps, poor sanitation, and inadequate maternal nutrition persist. Strengthening community-based counseling for the crucial first 1,000 days is urged as a vital step.

title: Govt sets 3-hour deadline for social media platforms to remove flagged AI deepfakes
content: New government rules now mandate clear labelling for all AI-generated content, including deepfakes and synthetic audio, starting February 20. Social media platforms must verify user declarations on AI content and embed traceable metadata.  Takedown timelines have been drastically reduced to as little as three hours for certain violations, with platforms also required to warn users about penalties.

title: Rajpal Yadav surrenders in Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case; look at his fees and net worth
content: Comedian Rajpal Yadav has made headlines again, this time for surrendering to Tihar Jail after the Delhi High Court refused to extend the timeline on a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce matter.

title: Redemption for Netherland's Bas de Leede at Kotla; buries 2023 ODI WC ghost
content: Bas de Leede delivered a match-winning all-round performance against Namibia in Delhi, a venue where he previously set an unwanted ODI record. His unbeaten 72 and two wickets secured Netherlands' first T20 World Cup win, erasing the memory of a tough outing against Australia in 2023.

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.

title: Who will hoist the Heisman in 2026? A way-too-early look

title: LeBron calls out Lakers: We're not a title team
content: leBron James says the Lakers aren't a championship team after their loss to Oklahoma City . the lakers and Thunder relied on their supporting casts to play a Thunder-style physical game . "you want me to compare us to them?" he says .

title: Reunions, new faces and promotions: Tracking the Power 4 coordinator moves
content: college football's coordinator carousel is often about the next big thing, the name you don't know yet but will soon enough . Chad Morris is back as offensive coordinator at Clemson . he helped engineer the program's rise alongside Dabo Swinney from 2011 to 2014 .

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see in spring training

title: Welcome to the offseason: What you need to know about key dates, biggest questions

title: Vrabel: Pats to keep embattled Campbell at LT
